page.title: 15A Night Shift Coalminer
page.content: At 9 p.m. my father catches the miners bus which takes him from the bottom of our hill to the Nantgarw Windsor Colliery about 25 miles away. He arrives at about 9.50 p.m. and goes to the canteen for a glass of milk or tea. At 10.50 p.m. he goes to the lockers and changes into his working clothes. Then he goes to the lamproom and collects his lamp and self-rescuer . When he is ready he gives a signal to the winder who lowers him down a shaft. When he arrives at the pit bottom he leaves the cage and catches the train.The train takes him for about a mile to his place of work. Ay 22.30 a.m. he stops for 20 minutes to have a dink and some sandwiches. His shift finishes at 5.30 a.m. When he arrives back on the surface he returns his equipment, has a shower and catches the bus home.
